lines.text: Ye will see the very persons of our noble story as they were living.
I advise you to consider that the Cardinal is all powerful.
I have been to you a true and humble wife.
It is you who have blown this coal betwixt my Lord and me.
I do refuse you for my judge and appeal unto the Pope.
I abhor this dilatory sloth and tricks of Rome.

O, Cromwell, Cromwell! Had I but served my God with half the zeal I served my King, he would not have in my age Have left me naked to mine enemies Farewell, the hope of Court! My hopes in Heaven to dwell!
Men's evil manners live in brass; their virtues We write in water.
Tis better to be lowly born And range with humble livers in content Than to be perk'd up in a glistening grief And wear a golden sorrow.
my robe And my integrity to heaven is all I dare now call my own.
